intro: Biscutella intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. Biscutella intermedia is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
